text: Olivarez at the 2019 Texas Book Festival José Olivarez is an author, poet and educator from Calumet City, Illinois, U.S. His first full collection of poetry is Citizen Illegal (2018, ), published by Haymarket Books. Citizen Illegal was shortlisted for the $75,000 2019 PEN/Jean Stein Book Award. == Education and early life == Jose Olivarez the son of Mexican immigrants, graduated from Harvard University. == Career and writing == Olivarez's work has been featured in the New York Times, the Paris Review, and Poetry Magazine, among others. In 2014, he co-authored the collection Home Court. Haymarket Books published his first full collection, Citizen Illegal, in 2018. Citizen Illegal was shortlisted for the $75,000 2019 PEN/Jean Stein Book Award. He is co-editor, along with Willie Perdomo and Felicia Chavez, of the forthcoming anthology The Breakbeat Poets Vol. 4: LatiNext. He has received fellowships from several organizations, including a 2016 Poets House Emerging Poets Fellowship and a 2019 Ruth Lilly and Dorothy Sargent Rosenberg Fellowship from the Poetry Foundation. Olivarez worked for the writing and education organizations Urban Word in New York and Young Chicago Authors, which produces the youth poetry festival, Louder than a Bomb.
